concise_definition: n. 曲线, 弯曲; v. 弯曲, 使成曲线

definitions.explanation_en: A smooth, continuous bend or line that deviates from straightness, often forming part of a circle, ellipse, or other geometric shape.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一条平滑、连续的弯曲线条，偏离直线，通常构成圆、椭圆或其他几何形状的一部分。
definitions.example_en: The road ahead has a sharp curve, so drive carefully.
definitions.example_cn: 前方道路有一个急转弯，请小心驾驶。

definitions.explanation_en: A graphical representation of data showing the relationship between two variables, often plotted on a coordinate system.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在坐标系中绘制的、用以表示两个变量之间关系的数据图形。
definitions.example_en: The graph shows a clear upward curve in sales over the past year.
definitions.example_cn: 这张图表显示过去一年销售额呈明显上升趋势。

definitions.explanation_en: A grading system in which scores are adjusted relative to the performance of the entire group, often to account for test difficulty.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指一种评分制度，根据全组表现调整分数，通常用于补偿考试难度过高。
definitions.example_en: The professor curved the exam grades so that the highest score became 100.
definitions.example_cn: 教授对考试成绩进行了曲线加分，使最高分变为100分。

definitions.explanation_en: To bend or cause something to take a curved shape, often gradually or smoothly.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指使某物弯曲或使其呈现曲线形状，通常为逐渐或平滑地弯曲。
definitions.example_en: The river curves gently around the hills.

definitions.explanation_en: To adjust grades or scores according to a statistical distribution, typically to ensure a desired spread of results.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指根据统计分布调整分数，通常是为了确保成绩呈现预期的分布范围。
definitions.example_en: The teacher curved the test results to reflect a normal distribution.
definitions.example_cn: 老师对测试成绩进行了曲线调整，使其符合正态分布。

comparison.analysis: “Bend” (弯曲) 是一个更通用、更口语化的词，指任何从直线变为非直线的状态，可以是突然的、不规则的，甚至轻微的变形。而 “curve” 更强调平滑、连续、有美感或几何规律的弯曲，常用于数学、物理或设计语境。
“Arc” (弧线) 是 “curve” 的一种特定类型，特指圆或椭圆的一部分，具有明确的半径和中心点。它更精确、更几何化，而 “curve” 是一个更宽泛的术语，包括任意形状的弯曲线条，不一定是圆弧。
“Contour” (轮廓线) 指物体外部边缘的曲线，尤其用于地形图或绘画中表现形状和深度。它强调的是边界或外形，而 “curve” 可以是任何内部或外部的弯曲，不一定构成边界。
